image.altText: A man rides his motorbike through rubble in the dark

props.synopsis: Loud explosions have been heard in Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir, where India says it has attacked "terrorist infrastructure". Follow live.

title.children: Pakistan's prime minister vows India's attacks will 'not go unpunished'

image.altText: Macquarie Group headquarters, Sydney

props.synopsis: Investment bank Macquarie is hit with additional licence conditions as the corporate regulator slams "multiple and significant compliance failures".

title.children: ASIC takes action against Macquarie for 'significant' failures

image.altText: Angus Taylor Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: Liberal deputy Sussan Ley and Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor firm as the two likely contenders for the party's leadership, as a split emerges among Coalition MPs over what to do with its nuclear proposal.

title.children: Liberal leadership race narrows to two likely contenders, Ley and Taylor

image.altText: Clive Palmer NPC

props.synopsis: Reactionary newspapers and the outdoor advertising sector might have immediately profited from the last few weeks of the election campaign but it didn't seem to help politicians at the polls.

title.children: A feedback loop tanked Dutton's campaign in its final week

image.altText: Liberal Party launch in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Nationals are holding firm on their nuclear policy as a Liberal senator breaks ranks to demand it be ditched. Follow live.

title.children: Nationals leader backs in nuclear as Liberal senator demands it be scrapped

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wilson says he believes in a future with nuclear power
Tim Wilson gets emotional as he claims victory in Goldstein
Nuclear wasn't the reason why the Coalition lost the election: Littleproud

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson is accused of murdering three relatives by serving them beef Wellington laced with poisonous mushrooms. Follow the trial in our live blog.

title.children: Daughters of mushroom lunch guests give evidence to murder trial

image.altText: NSW Police Commissioner Karen Webb and AFP Commissioner Reece Kershaw give press conference to media.

props.synopsis: Karen Webb became the first woman to lead the country's largest police force in February 2022.

title.children: 'True trailblazer' Karen Webb to step down as NSW police commissioner

image.altText: External images of Reiby Youth Detention Centre.

props.synopsis: For three years a NSW government department fought to stop the release of footage of an alleged assault on a teenager at a youth detention centre.

title.children: Court orders release of 'vicious' CCTV footage after three-year legal battle

image.altText: A sea of red robes as a group of cardinals in robes are pictured from beind at a mass in  Peter's Square.

props.synopsis: There are many names circulating for who may succeed Pope Francis, but history shows the rumoured frontrunners are rarely picked. Here's a look at some of the candidates who stand out for different reasons.

title.children: Meet the stand-out cardinals who could replace Pope Francis

image.altText: A black rubber gloved hand holds a petri dish that is growing violet-coloured bacteria.

props.synopsis: A deadly disease outbreak associated with the wet season in Northern Australia has created a medical mystery for Queensland scientists who are working tirelessly to understand its spread.

title.children: Scientists racing against the clock to tackle an 'unprecedented' threat

image.altText: Jessie smiles, wearing a white tshirt and purple blazer, surrounded by supporters in orange t-shirts.

props.synopsis: The ABC's election computer projects independent candidate for the ACT seat of Bean Jessie Price will finish ahead.

title.children: Independent Jessie Price closing in on a 'not-so-safe' Labor seat

props.synopsis: What data about voters' age, income level and home ownership status can tell us about the election result.

title.children: An old voting trend 'is breaking down' – and hurting the Coalition

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Xi Jinping shake hands in front of chinese and australian flags

props.synopsis: Xi Jinping sees Australia as a strategic partner — a relatively stable player amid the turbulence of Beijing's deteriorating relationship with the United States.

title.children: China congratulated Albanese on election night. That tells us a lot

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese in front of a crowd after the 2025 federal election

props.synopsis: The election may be over, but cost of living is still front of mind for Australians. These graphs show how we got here and what the new government has to do to rein in rising prices.

title.children: How did the cost of living get so bad? These graphs show how prices skyrocketed

image.altText: A woman with glasses wearing a  grey blazer stands in a tv studio

props.synopsis: Tingle, a Walkley-Award-winning journalist, will take up the post mid-year, joining a network of foreign correspondents around the globe.

title.children: 7.30's Laura Tingle to become ABC's new Global Affairs Editor

image.altText: A composit image of a charging battery symbol and a man installing rooftop solar.

props.synopsis: Slashing the price of home batteries was one of Labor's flagship policies during the election campaign. With the election now in the review mirror, it's now time to look at what's exactly on offer in its Cheaper Home Batteries Program.

title.children: Labor's home battery subsidy kicks off 'strong demand'

image.altText: Melissa Jansen

props.synopsis: Labor gained seven seats in Queensland, snatching five from the LNP including suburban seats once considered a sure thing for the Coalition.

title.children: 'Dutton, absolutely not': Howard's battlers turn away from the LNP

image.altText: NAB bank signage in red, black and white colours

props.synopsis: National Australia Bank's half-year profit drops 2.5 per cent, and the ASX is off to a better-than-expected start after the US and China confirmed they will hold negotiations this week in an attempt to scale back their trade war. Follow live.

title.children: NAB profit falls 2.5pc, ASX buoyed by US-China talks to 'de-escalate' trade war

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What's happening on the markets today?
Rise in living costs for all Australian households by income type
Trade shortages continue, despite low levels of new home building

image.altText: A close-up shot of WA Premier Roger Cook speaking at a media conference outside wearing a hard hat and hi-vis vest.

props.synopsis: WA Roger Cook says he won't "shackle" the state to legislation enshrining climate targets, and emissions may instead rise in the state as it develops a "green steel" industry.

title.children: WA premier pulls back on climate targets, says emissions may rise

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Premier has told state parliament there will be no Tasmania Devils AFL team — unless MPs pass special legislation to enable a stadium to be built at Hobart's Macquarie Point and stop the current planning process for the stadium.

title.children: Rockliff warns Tasmania's AFL journey 'will end' unless stadium legislation passes

image.altText: Two small boys, with faces blurred, in a karate class.

props.synopsis: Two boys, aged six and seven, whose bodies were found in a home in Central West NSW were due to receive their yellow belts in karate this evening.

title.children: Dead Coonabarabran brothers were set to receive yellow karate belts tonight

image.altText: Bilal Haouchar with beard, beige jacket

props.synopsis: Bilal Haouchar fled Australia in 2018 while awaiting kidnapping charges but police allege he has maintained control of the Sydney drug trade while overseas.

title.children: Fugitive accused Sydney drug boss jailed in Lebanon

image.altText: Exterior of the building, which is surrounded by skyscrapers

props.synopsis: In the middle of a housing crisis, when a sizeable amount of commercial real estate is sitting vacant, the Make Room project is billed as a blueprint for giving under-utilised buildings new life as residential spaces - and lowering carbon emissions in the process.

title.children: How an empty building in Melbourne's CBD was transformed into a home

image.altText: Old photo of Edith Cowan, she is not smiling or looking at camera. She wears a dark dress and a white neck piece.

props.synopsis: A murder in colonial Perth almost 150 years ago shocked the country and inspired Edith Cowan, the woman on Australia's $50 note, to fight for the rights of women.

title.children: The murder that divided Perth and roused a campaign for women's rights

image.altText: A man walks up a ramp towards a door with a sign reading Naracoorte Courthouse, with a woman behind him and media to the side

props.synopsis: Independent MP Nick McBride has appeared in court for the first time since being charged with assaulting his wife.

title.children: SA MP appears in court over assault charges

image.altText: House fire Harristown

props.synopsis: A body has been found and three people have life-threatening burns after a house fire in Toowoomba, west of Brisbane.

title.children: Body found, three sustain life-threatening burns after Toowoomba house fire

image.altText: Mark Carney and Donald Trump speak in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: The cordial tone of the leaders' meeting mostly belied the bitter trade war being fought by their countries.

title.children: 'Takes two to tango': Takeaways from the Trump-Carney White House chat

image.altText: Trump squints in the sun, serious, wears blue coat, tie, shirt, sits on red couch.

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump says the US will not bomb Houthis after the Iran-aligned group agreed to stop interrupting important shipping lanes in the Middle East.

title.children: Trump announces deal to stop bombing Houthis, end shipping attacks

image.altText: A woman stands looking at small jewels which are encased in a square wooden frame inside a glass case

props.synopsis: Jewels linked to the physical remains of the Buddha are set to be sold at auction, sparking a threat of legal action from India and moral questions about the sale of religious antiquities.

title.children: India threatens legal action over sale of ancient jewels

image.altText: Geraldine Viswanathan attends the World Premiere of Marvel Studios' "Thunderbolts*" at Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, California

props.synopsis: Thunderbolts* is being praised as the best Marvel film in years, and Australian actor Geraldine Viswanathan might just be its "secret weapon".

title.children: Geraldine Viswanathan went from triple j trainee to Marvel

image.altText: family with backpacks in snowy landscape

props.synopsis: After a long career as an accomplished TV and radio journalist for programs like AM, This Day Tonight and Beyond 2000, Iain Finlay chooses to end life on his own terms with his family by his side.

title.children: Hours before dying, ABC legend Finlay embraced last 'great adventure'

image.altText: Caleb Ewan holds out his hands

props.synopsis: By announcing his sudden retirement from professional cycling, Caleb Ewan stuck to the old adage that you should always leave them wanting more, even if that means there will always be questions over his career.

title.children: Like all great performers, Caleb Ewan bowed out leaving fans wanting more

image.altText: A tiny mouse-like creature in someone's hands

props.synopsis: The tiny mammal's population was decimated by drought and bushfires, but after five years of struggle, they are starting to thrive.

title.children: From slim chance to 'shiny and fat', pygmy possums back from the brink

image.altText: GettyImages-2211094293

props.synopsis: More claims of threats towards opposition players from Port Adelaide star Willie Rioli emerge as the AFL tries to unpick the situation.

title.children: Koch 'incredibly angry' with Rioli as AFL scrambles to take action

image.altText: Jack Doohan walks down pit lane at Miami Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: As Jack Doohan's time at Alpine appears to be coming to an end amid team changes, F1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri offers encouragement to his compatriot.

title.children: Piastri backs fellow Aussie Doohan as Alpine F1 boss quits
